subject: Re: [junit] trouble with junitx
msgSnippet: ... A silly question: does myMethodName(null) actually throw NullPointerException? Make the method public, write a normal JUnit test, then try it. ... I have
messageBody:
jhraigniac wrote:

> Hi,
>
> I am trying to use junitx to test private classes / methods.
> First, I intented to send this mail to Andreas Heilwagen but
> couldn't get any valid mail so maybe someone will have answers here.
>
> I encounter a trouble when trying to test a private method with
> one String parameter, when I set it to null (checking if it raises
> an expected exception).
>
> While
>
> invoke(myInstance, "myMethodName", new Object[] { myValidString });
>
> runs fine,
>
> invoke(myInstance, "myMethodName", new Object[] { null });
>
> raises a java.lang.NullPointerException.

A silly question: does myMethodName(null) actually throw
NullPointerException? Make the method public, write a normal JUnit test,
then try it.

> By the way, where is the source code in
> http://www.extreme-java.de/dist/junitx-src-5.1.zip ?

I have no idea. If it isn't there, then I don't know where it is.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
